lead_paragraph: Days of extraordinary rainfall — some places recorded more than 20 inches in less than 72 hours — have led thousands of people to evacuate.

byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Pearl River, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.
byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and ALAN BLINDER

headline.print_headline: Destruction Mounts as Floodwaters Engulf Louisiana
headline.main: Destruction Mounts as Floodwaters Engulf Louisiana

snippet: Days of extraordinary rainfall — some places recorded more than 20 inches in less than 72 hours — have led thousands of people to evacuate.
abstract: States of emergency have been declared in Mississippi and Louisiana as authorities and residents scramble to manage extensive damage cased by flooding after unprecedented rainfall; thousands of residents have evacuated and four deaths have been reported.
